intro: Rondeletia standleyana, commonly known as the velvetleaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a velvety texture, giving it its common name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in shaded, moist environments.
